org.jpasecurity

Interface AccessManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SecureEntityManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CriteriaEntityFilter, DefaultAccessManager, DefaultSecureEntityManager, EntityFilter

    public interface AccessManager
    Implementations of this interface may be used to check whether an entity is accessible given a specific access type.
    Author:
    Arne Limburg

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isAccessible(AccessType accessType, Object entity)
      Checks whether the specified entity is accessible with the specified access type.
      boolean isAccessible(AccessType accessType, String entityName, Object... constructorArgs)
      Checks whether an entity with the specified name, that was constructed with the specified constructor-arguments would be accessible with the specified access-type.

    • Method Detail

      • isAccessible

        boolean isAccessible(AccessType accessType,
                   String entityName,
                   Object... constructorArgs)
        Checks whether an entity with the specified name, that was constructed with the specified constructor-arguments would be accessible with the specified access-type.
        Parameters:
        accessType - the access type
        entityName - the name of the entity (may be entity-name according to the JPA Spec or fully qualified class-name)
        constructorArgs - the constructor-arguments
        Returns:
        whether the entity is accessible

      • isAccessible

        boolean isAccessible(AccessType accessType,
                   Object entity)
        Checks whether the specified entity is accessible with the specified access type.
        Parameters:
        accessType - the access type
        entity - the entity
        Returns:
        whether the entity is accessible
